children.subject: Not putting this in the student answer because I have no personal experience with these classes, but 162 and 189 are among the hardest CS upper divs, and if you added even one more upper div to that schedule it's already very intense. Taking all five of these would be absolutely ridiculous. If you have to choose between 188 and 189, definitely take 188 - it's considerably lighter, albeit with difficult exams. Good luck!

history.content:
Not sure, but if you need 20 units for major requirements, you have to take all 5 of them for a letter grade.

161: Two Midterms, Three Projects, Four Homeworks, Final

- Similar to 61C workload.

162: Three Midterms, Three Projects, Four Homeworks, No Final

- Projects are in groups of ~4. Going in without a group is not recommended.

168: One Midterm, Three Projects, No Homework, Final

- Similar to 61A/B workload.

188: One Midterm, 6 Projects, 8 Homeworks, Final

- Similar to 61A/B workload. Light Homeworks, tough tests.

189: One Midterm, No Projects, Weekly Homework, Final

- Similar to 170 in style. Problems sets harder.

Compared to your current schedule of [EE16B, 61C, 170, 186], it's going to be more work in the sense you'd probably have no time to do anything else. Might want to talk to an advisor about your situation though.

Not sure, but if you need 20 units for major requirements, you have to take all 5 of them for a letter grade.

161: Two Midterms, Three Projects, Four Homeworks, Final

- Similar to 61C workload.

162: Three Midterms, Three Projects, Four Homeworks, No Final

- Projects are in groups of ~4. Going in without a group is not recommended.

168: One Midterm, Three Projects, No Homework, Final

- Similar to 61A/B workload.

188: One Midterm, 6 Projects, 8 Homeworks, Final

- Similar to 61A/B workload.

189: One Midterm, No Projects, Weekly Homework, Final

- Similar to 170 in style.

Compared to your current schedule of [EE16B, 61C, 170, 186], it's going to be more work in the sense you'd probably have no time to do anything else. Might want to talk to an advisor about your situation though.

children.subject: I also decided to graduate one semester earlier than planned. If you're CS at L&S, make sure that you will have fulfilled 6 upper div units outside of your major by the end of Fall - I almost missed this point, planned on taking 161, 162, 168, and 186 which would fulfill all major requirements and upper div units requirements as well, but not those 6 (I have taken only one class for 4 units). I suggest you make an appointment with L&S advisor to go over your plan, just to be safe.

history.content:
So, my plan for next semester is to take CS161, 162, 168, 188 and 189 with P/NP. I know it sounds crazy and it will be really really heavy, but due to family issue, I have to graduate next semester (1 semester less than regular). I only need to take 20 more units upper division, 16 of them are for major requirement and 4 for upper division requirement.

In the past, I have done [CS61A/B, 70, MATH113, EE47D, AC] in one semester and I am currently taking [EE16B, 61C, 170, 186]. How hard would it be for my last semester here (compared to my other 2 semesters)? Also, if this plan sounds impractical, what are the recommendations? I would definitely take 161,162 and 168 but I am okay to swap CS188/189 out but that seems to be pretty important for CS career path too.
history.subject: 20 units needed: 4 tech + 1 upper
